intro: Linociera tetrandra, commonly known as the four-threaded linociera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Linociera tetrandra is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
